Submodules#

atom.utils module#

atom.utils.check_uid_availability(metagraph, uid, vpermit_tao_limit=10000, coldkeys=None, ips=None)[source]#

Check if uid is available. The UID should be available if it is serving and has less than vpermit_tao_limit stake :param metagraph (: obj: bt.metagraph): Metagraph object :type uid: int :param uid: uid to be checked :type uid: int :type vpermit_tao_limit: int :param vpermit_tao_limit: Validator permit tao limit :type vpermit_tao_limit: int :type coldkeys: set :param coldkeys: Set of coldkeys to exclude :type coldkeys: set :type ips: set :param ips: Set of ips to exclude :type ips: set

Returns:

True if uid is available, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

atom.utils.get_top_incentive_uids(metagraph, k, vpermit_tao_limit=10000)[source]#

get the top k uids with the highest incentives.

Parameters:

  • metagraph (bt.metagraph)

  • k (int) – Number of uids.

  • vpermit_tao_limit (int, optional) – Amount of stake that we decide determines if a hotkey is a validator. Defaults to 10_000.

Returns:

sorted top-k miners.

Return type:

List[int]

atom.utils.get_validator_data(metagraph)[source]#

Retrieve validator data (hotkey, percent stake) from metagraph.

Return type:

Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]

atom.utils.is_validator(uid, metagraph, stake_needed=10000)[source]#

Checks if a UID on the subnet is a validator.

Return type:

bool

atom.utils.run_command(command, cwd=None)[source]#

Runs a subprocess command.

Return type:

str
